item.title: bhairavI-venkaTasubbayya
item.description: The Musician who Sliced Off his Tongue to Avoid Singing in Tipu Sultan’s Durbar A brief episode from a Kannada novel featuring a heroic singer who defied Tipu Sultan’s authority. AUTHORED BY T.R. SUBBA RAO (Ta Ra Su), the Kannada novel Hamsageethe narrates the life and musical Sadhana of a classical singer, Venkatasubbayya who lived during the reign of Madakarinayaka, the last Palegar of Chitradurga. For our purposes, his life is distinguished chiefly by two major episodes.
